Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the water quality in the ocean by stating it is "perfect."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion of perfect water quality.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that testing up and down every ocean shore in New Jersey is sufficient to determine the overall water quality in the ocean.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative perspectives or opinions from environmental experts who disagree with the assessment of perfect water quality.
